content:
Posted: July 3, 2016
												It may be squalid and zombie-infested, but Dying Light's city of Harran isn't a depressing wasteland – it's a vibrant, ambitious, open-world playground. Here, buildings are for climbing, the undead are there to be destroyed in creative ways, and there's always something interesting to be discovered nearby. It takes a while for that to become clear, though; at first, you might even think Dying Light is really about running scared from mobs of seemingly unconquerable zombies, who can quickly drain your stamina and wear out your improvised weapons. Don't be fooled.

												Both the maps are incredibly dense with interesting geography and architecture - every square inch of the world is worth having in the game, there are no barren wastelands or boring buildings that serve as nothing more than obstacles, but at the same time the maps are large enough that you would wish there were vehicles if not for zee jumping and zee leaping and zee climbing mamma miaSome of the textures are sloppy but the way it looks in motion is A+.Because modern technology allows such brutal, graphic combat and incredibly seamless parkour, it shows that no matter how good the games of the past were, this game is just as fun purely out of how well the features have been implemented, even if it's not quite as compelling as Bioshock or sucking you into another dimension like Oblivion. 9/10 my goty

content:
Posted: March 8, 2016
												Before I get in to my thoughts on the game, allow me to tell a story of something that happened to me about a year ago. So I'd recently moved states (a year ago) and we got here when there was a ridiculous amount of snow on the ground. Now, being from Florida, you'd expect me to freak out and panic and scream about how badly I want to kill myself because my hands are cold or something but you'd be wrong. I hated the heat. ♥♥♥♥ the heat. at least in the cold you can just put more clothes on. In the heat? you can only take so much off before the cops bring out the black censor bars (for those of you that don't know, you are 100% allowed to get fully naked in florida because of the heat, but the cops have to be called so they can bring out black censor bars to stick to your body. I know it sounds weird but it was a good thing. It was still too hot though. and you can't just take off your ♥♥♥♥ing skin when you're too hot. Florida ♥♥♥♥ing SUCKED. you were either near the beach, or in a ♥♥♥♥ing swamp. The more north you went, the more "southern" the people got. It was a nightmare). But that's not what I wanted to talk about. long story short: I enjoy the cold and the snow even though I was born and raised in florida and even if yawning outside makes my nose burn like hell for 20+ seconds. SO back to what I had actually wanted to say... The house I live in is literally RIGHT across the street from some.. woods. forest? I don't know the ♥♥♥♥ing difference. the point is I can walk right across the street and instantly be surrrounded by a lot of trees. In those woods forest♥♥♥♥♥♥place there lives animals I have NEVER Seen in my life (in person). they would be "Deer". Now, sure, we HAD deer in florida... but have I ever seen one there? No. As far as I know, they didn't exist there. you NEVER saw deer there. You were more likely to see alligators than deer (and that is not an exaggeration). So when we got here, I saw deer for the first time and they are ♥♥♥♥ing COOL. I remember my first time seeing them here was at like around 2am when I finally decided to get to bed (yes I have a terrible sleep schedule. I always stay up until at least 2am. I'm slowly dying as a result but I refuse to change), I looked out my window and BAM. there were TWO deer outside. It was the best moment of my life (at that point). And it's funny becuase I thought seeing TWO deer at once was lucky and a lot of them to see at once, but the other night I saw 8 outside my window. EIGHT! Man, back in florida I was missing out. Never going back there. ♥♥♥♥ that ♥♥♥♥♥♥ state

content:
Posted: November 3, 2015
												Well, Just finished this game and theres some good and some bad about it.I played on all high settings and the game looked fantastic and played very smoothly.The Good:-Parkour mechanic is good and works well.- Some pretty well developed characters.- A story you can really get into.- Some fun weapons.- Some good combat techniques.- Early game is very immersive and makes you want to keep playing.- The game is optimized quite well.The Meh:- Voice acting feels forced.- Theres like 5 guns, the pistols are pretty much the same anyway.- Last 15% of the game just drags.- The night part of the game is okay but is pretty♥♥♥♥♥♥and was underused.The Bad:- The ending is♥♥♥♥♥♥br>- The ending is a quicktime event- The ending is predictable- The ending is like Modern Warfare 2 - The price, only buy if its on sale.Overall, I really did enjoy this game but the ending really lets it down. its a well made game that is pretty well optimized and can be very immersive in the first half. Honestly, the second half of the game feels like its been made by different people as its very different from the first half. the last part of the game drags out and honestly can get a little boring. I would rate this game 8/10.Thank you for taking the time to read my review.

No. As far as I know, they didn't exist there. you NEVER saw deer there. You were more likely to see alligators than deer (and that is not an exaggeration). So when we got here, I saw deer for the first time and they are ♥♥♥♥ing COOL. I remember my first time seeing them here was at like around 2am when I finally decided to get to bed (yes I have a terrible sleep schedule. I always stay up until at least 2am. I'm slowly dying as a result but I refuse to change), I looked out my window and BAM. there were TWO deer outside. It was the best moment of my life (at that point). And it's funny becuase I thought seeing TWO deer at once was lucky and a lot of them to see at once, but the other night I saw 8 outside my window. EIGHT! Man, back in florida I was missing out. Never going back there. ♥♥♥♥ that ♥♥♥♥♥♥ state

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 8, 2015
												Well, finished Dying Light, not going to play it again ever. Was sorta good while it lasted.Don't bother conserving weaponry, just use whatever you can find and whatever upgrades you have at the moment. By the time your weapon breaks, if it's a decent one, you'll either have found a stronger one earlier on or be easily able to buy whatever store weapon is the strongest at that time. The economy is completely broken and pretty much meaningless. Likewise you'll never run out of medkits: make them whenever you have materials, buy two every time you open the shop since they're dirt cheap, take whatever you find in airdrops. After the first 5% of the game, you'll never run out.Parkour is super fun. It's the heart of game. Be warned there are some annoying ledges-and-edges-that-turn-out-to-be-ungrabbable here and there. If it's a rock cliff, fugadaboudit. If you think 40 hours of parkour plus some simple zombie combat (the best tactic is still swing at heads with a bit of dodging, the special moves leave you vulnerable) is worth the price, get this game. I frankly got this due to not having much else to play. You may want to wait till a deal brings it to the 20 dollar mark.Don't really see how Be The Zombie can be fun. Basically you're a troll who gets killed a lot. No ladder etc.Characters are not very interesting. Your charater's voice acting is pretty decent and get entertaingly snarky here and there. Bad guy is like FC3 Vaas diluted to one part per ten parts water. Plot may not make much sense due to railroaded feelings that have nothing to do with the gamer's experience, eg massive grief over characters you literally spoke to about four times.Ending was a horrible QTE, not to mention the carbon copy of COD's famed <spoilers ahead> pull knife out of your body to stab super evil bad guy. I had no technical issues whatsoever. Of course I'm using a i3 and R9 290, so if your processor is AMD or your graphics card is less powerful, it might get tricky.

Posted: February 9, 2015
												This game is fun. Very fun.I'll confess, I don't know what it's like to play by yourself (apart from the first mission/tutorial mission) as I've played the game so far with my boyfriend. The co-op is very easy and works really well (unlike some coop in games like Dead Rising 3). It might take a little bit to get used to the controls/free running but once you do, the game seems pretty fluid. The missions seem fun and you get involved in the story, I even got angry at the playable character when he did something pretty scumbaggy on orders. But anyway, I would definitely recommend this game to anyone who loves zombie games. It's not as hilarious as Dead Rising 3 and not as horrifyingly scary (imo) as Dead Island games, but it's probably the most fluid one out there and if you want scary/tough, there's always the nighttime.

												This game is awesome. The free running is done really well, the fighting is great, and the skills you learn as you level up are pretty useful. Vault over zombies! Slide under zombies! Fire your grappling hook at a wall and pull yourself through zombies! Slice, stab, kick, burn, electrocute, poison, ram, and smash zombies like you never smashed them before!That being said, it's really -- a much less buggy Dead Island/Mirrors Edge/Farcry 3(4?) rolled into one!Night time brings the real zasty ones that you can't really outrun or fight in a safe manner, so it's more of a stealth game at night...or run like you got caught sleeping with the police chiefs wife!

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 10, 2015
												Preface: I liked mirrors edge and I have played a lot of shooters/melee games. I did not  like dead island but did like it's option to throw melee weapons and modify them.Now that that I have declared the things which may lead me to have some bias we can get on with it. The game has a reasonably good storyline albeit somewhat predictable at times. The reason for you being in the situation makes sense, the interavtion with other characters makes sense. If I were to criticise any character ni the ggame it would be the main character for not developing much of a personality until about 60-70% of the way into the story. You may have heard that it relis upon a damsel in destress storyline, this is NOT the case with the "damsel" saving your life at least twice during the course of the game.The combat is good and relatively fluid. you can equip 4 melee weapons at a time and 4 utilities ranging from a UV torch to electricuted riot shields. The stamina systems keep the game challenging and the different "special infected" range from irritating to down right deadly and maintain that position until relatively late into the game.The weapon crafting is reasonable extensible with the ability to add effects such as fire or impact to weapons as well as modifications which add to damage, handling or durability to varying degrees.The exp rewards are reasonable and the skills you can unlock are helpful with only one of them, the grappling hook, really detracting to the difficulty of the game bar the ultimate upgrade from each tree, which essentially give you infinite stamina for their associated ability e.g. agility gemoves running and climbing stamina costs.The different skill trees do add a lot of different playstyles to your arsenal and I will say it again none of the upgrades feel boken.There is a reasonable amount of humour in the game including one of my favourite insults I have heard in years from "the twins" who are a pair of intelligent yet condescending brothers with an inability to relate to other people.The co-op is a good laugh and saves any progress you make to your campaign evein if you are not the host.Overall I would recommend this game a lot. It may not be original but it has taken the best parts of a lot of games with only a few issues that I have noticed.

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 7, 2015
												Dying Light is an open world first person zombie action game from the developers of Dead Island. I was very disappointed by Dead Island, so I almost didn't bother playing Dying Light at all, but I took a chance and it turns out that Dying Light is ... okay. Not great, but not terrible either. It has some problems but I had some fun with it and its certainly better than Dead Island.GameplayThe combat is primarily focused on melee. There are some guns (pistol, rifle, shotgun) but ammo is rare and the noise just attracts more zombies, so I only used guns on story missions against Human bandits. You can also find and craft throwable weapons such as knives, molotovs and grenades which are useful against large groups of zombies. But most of the time, you'll be using a variety of blades and blunt weapons to slice and bludgeon your way through the undead.At the start of the game, your character is very weak. The weapons do hardly any damage, it can take around ten hits to kill each zombie, and because every attack uses stamina, by the time you've killed one you're out of breath. Fighting multiple zombies together is basically impossible. So you have a tedious situation where you have to kill one, run away (combat stamina and movement stamina are different), wait for stamina to recharge, go back, kill another, repeat. You can easily avoid zombies by climbing on top of cars or buildings, but sooner or later you to have to fight, because you need the XP to get stronger.After a few hours, the combat does start to get more enjoyable. You'll unlock abilities to get more stamina and health. You'll find weapons that do alot more damage. You can unlock special moves, such as the ability to stomp on the head of a zombie lying on the ground for an instant kill. Eventually you're strong enough to kill zombies in one or two hits and you've got enough stamina to fight a horde of a dozen zombies with no problem. I tended to use alot of blades, so when I was chopping off zombie arms and heads I felt a bit like Michonne from the Walking Dead TV show.There are a few types of special zombies, although nothing we haven't seen before in other games, especially Left 4 Dead. There are spitters, exploders, chargers, and tanks. And then there are the "volatiles", who only attack at night and are really dangerous, so its best to just sneak past or run away from them. They're not too hard to kill individually, but it seems like if one sees you, every other volatile in the city is instantly alerted to your location so you end up getting swarmed. Fighting against Humans is the weakest part of combat. Especially after you've found a gun, their AI is so dumb that they provide no challenge to a veteran FPS gamer.StoryFor some reason the story never really excited me. Its kinda basic - the city of Harran has been quarantined because zombies happened and the player character, Kyle Crane, has been parachuted in to try and find research relating to a cure. There are a bunch of friendly civilians who need your help to survive and there's also a bandit leader who is evil because reasons. (It was something stupid like his brother died on the first day of the outbreak so he decided that everyone else should die as well). Most of the characters, including Crane, are lacking in personality. The voice actors did a decent job, but unfortunately the script writers just never gave them anything interesting to say.I guess I could have missed something, but if I did, its not my fault. This is one of those games that does the whole "I know you're surrounded by enemies but now this NPC is going to give you plot details over a radio even though you're not paying attention because you're trying to not die" thing. I prefer to have all the dialogue in a cutscene or at least a secure location, so that I can concentrate fully on what is being said.TechnicalGraphics are really nice, lots of detail in the buildings and environment, and performance is good. The recommended specs are quite demanding, and I'm right on the edge (I have an i7 2600K @ 3.4 Ghz, 8GB ram and a GTX 770 with 4GB vram) but I was able to maintain a mostly consistent 60 FPS without too much tweaking. I've turned off the useless stuff like motion blur, film grain and depth of field, I've got view distance turned down to around 1/4 of the bar (credit goes to Total Buscuit's port report video on Youtube for demonstrating the effect of that setting) and I've turned off Nvidia's special HBAO but left the normal version on. Everything else is on highest setting at 1920x1080. I've also forced Vsync through Nvidia control panel to eliminate screen tearing (the in game Vsync setting is useless).Sadly, there are lots of achievement bugs. Maybe not the most critical problem, but hey, I like unlocking achievements, especially after finishing a game's main story I can usually spend a few more hours achievement hunting. Most of the problems seem to be with achievements that require you to perform a certain action X number of times. I currently have seven different incomplete achievements where the counter seems to be stuck on 0 or 1, but I know I've done those actions loads of times. Meanwhile I've unlocked a coop achievement but I haven't even touched coop mode, and I unlocked two other achievements several hours before I actually performed their actions. Judging by the forums there are lots of other players experiencing similar bugs.RecommendationAs I said, despite my complaints, Dying Light is a decent game and I did have some fun with it. I think its worth playing, but I wouldn't class it as a high priority, especially if you have other games in your backlog that you're excited to play.

content:
Posted: April 26, 2015
												Absolutely entrancing, at least to me.  I never really could get into the Assassin's Creed II mojo, mainly because I disliked having to be stealthy so often.  And then I never really revisted that series.  Dying Light takes the parkour type movement that I did really like from AC, makes it feel even a bit more fluid like Mirror's Edge (but you do have to level up some before you're that level of competent), and combines it with combat that makes you feel powerful.Don't get me wrong, the hordes of zombies can be terrifying when you are new, because they can absolutely overwhelm you.  But later on I'm flipping over their heads and slashing skulls in half with one blow, and setting guys on fire with my insane propane-spewing hatchet-thing, and just feeling in general like a badass....and then night comes.  That whole power thing with traversal during the day is absolutely flipped on its head at night, and it's way more tense and dangerous than AC.  And this time I actualy like it, because I feel the fear of the monsters, not the ineptitude of my character.  I've already established that I'm a badass during the day, so the fact that these monsters at night practically insta-kill me if I get seen makes them all the more terrifying....and then, as you level up and as you learn more and more, suddenly you start being more powerful at night, too.  Suddenly the nights aren't quite so terrifying, and you can survive for a while if you hold your ground, heart pounding, fighting for your life but winning against the odds and having a blast doing it.  What a rush.I have never seen first-person melee combat that felt this good, to be frank.  There are some guns, but those tend to call in larger zombies (as do any other loud noises), and I preferred using melee in general.  Even when I could use throwing knives or similar, I'd avoid that at all costs.  Band of human psychos out to kill me with guns?  No problem, I'll just go from cover to cover and kill everyone with my electrified sickle.I am not a violent person, but there's something deeply cathartic here to me. ;)  I get the sort of feeling that I used to play when playing Quake II way back in the day.  This is a whole lot better, though.I have not had any technical glitches or other issues.  As soon as they make any more content, or a sequel or whatever, I'll be buying it.  It's just plain fun.

content:
Posted: March 14, 2015
												Dying Light: Basically Dead Island gone right as many of these reviews probably already say. I played through the whole game with a friend and I can say there wasn't a moment where I was getting bored of it, My friend and I mostly trying to avoid the main quests and mostly just screwing around/doing side quests had a blast and thought it was very unfortunate when there wren't a many side quests to do in the Old Town part, but the recent addition of Hard mode made it 10x more challenging and 10x more fun. We honestly could say we were getting bored of the game when we were able to one hit Goons, but with hard mode that was instantly fixed, even the normal zombies were made a challenge.The story focuses on Kyle Crane who is an agent sent in by the GRE to get files back from survivors who supposedly stole them, but to Crane's findings they actually were not the ones who stole them and so in turn he started helping them out, and thats pretty much how the introduction to the game starts. The story itself has a couple cliche moments but not enough to make the story predictable. There are a good amount of plot twists and parts that are honestly very sad when you realise what is happening.Overall I would rate it:8/10 Singleplayer10/10 MultiplayerSeriously, the addition of Co-op was probably the best thing this game has.My friend personally gives it:7/10 Singleplayer10/10 MultiplayerWe have gotten a full enjoyment of the game and I can say that all these hours I've spent in this game are well worth it.Thanks for reading.

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 30, 2015
												Price 35 dollars. Patch 1.5. Season pass installed. Single player only.Played in 1920x1080 on max settings. 100% complete all missions/side missions before review.Graphics 9/10 Beside some random slowdowns, gorgeous graphics.Sound 6/10 Great ambient sound. The infected sounds great. Voice acting horribleReplay value 3/10. A horrible story with paper-thin characters.Overall 8/10:I had a great time playing this game. No bugs beside some random slowdown. Did all missions/side missions in 4 gaming sessions /40 hours including the DLC missions.  Fun/Simple crafting system. Looting opportunists everywhere. A great climbing system ala Mirrors Edge. Different game play during day/night cycles. During day you can play Rambo, but during night stealth is a must.Some real annoying side mission/protection missions that re-spawned. Helping a guy sell stuff or another guy fishing during a zombie apocalypse does not seem likely. The game gets really easy when you learn how to camouflage from infected.  You can just run around and break every infected neck. There are however events during missions that will not trigger if you are camouflaged.The grabbing hook you can acquire during later parts of the game changes game play a lot. Suddenly you can just jump buildings and climb bridges with easy but during missions you are "to fatigued" to use the hook not to break game play.The game is not worth 60 dollars/50 euro full price. 30-40 is a fair value.The season pass is a bust. Dont get it. The extra missions are just more of the same.

content:
Posted: January 18, 2016
												If your looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if your looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.Ingredients:1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter2. 1/2 cup white sugar3. 1/2 cup brown sugar4. 1/4 cup water5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon6. 1 pinch salt7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie Directions:1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

												Just finished the game today. Really enjoyed it. It is pretty similar to Dead Island with the biggest difference being the vertical aspect of movement that Dead Island lacked. Parkour is a lot of fun and is similar to Mirror's Edge. The world is huge and open. Just about every building can be entered and explored. Loot is everywhere. Combat is fun. Crafting is fun. The quests are fun. Challenges are fun. Movement is fun. Almost everything about this game is simply fun.The storyline is really good as well and is lengthy. I logged 57 hours in the game and left out some of the stuff you can do although I feel confident that I covered almost all of it.I really only had 2 complaints. The first is that my frame rate would dip when one of the spitting special zombies would hit me in the face with spit. Possibly correctable with tweaked settings and/or improved hardware. The other is the "water blur" effect on the screen any time you get wet. It's super annoying and makes it nearly impossible to see anything for a good 5 seconds after you get out of the water.All in all I really enjoyed this game. It's fun just to run/parkour around the city. It almost becomes an art form after you get the hang of it. Well done, Techland!

content:
Posted: May 16, 2015
												"Good night, good luck." -- 10/10.To sum it up, Dying Light is what Dead Island should be.  The Dev got the right idea for the core game play: Parkour and salvaging.  It's almost perfect but still have a few areas that need polishing.  e.g. In Co-op, zoning should be done with a timeout (like Borderlands 2) instead of waiting for all players to synchronize.  The weapon depreciation concept is a bit dated (Diablo 1?).  The Dev should think about a better idea to have players to continue salvage and craft new equipment, and at the same time do not force them to abandon their previously crafted weapons using depreciation.The PvP zombie invasion is a nice touch borrowing from Dark Souls.  The story is alright though the QTE finale is probably not to everyone's taste.At last, this game has beautiful architecture!  To get the best out of it, run it in 4K with pre-patch drawing distance (8.26).Post v1.1.1 update.  Techland has finally added a Chromatic aberration toggle.  Review score has been upgraded to 10/10 as a result.  Good work Techland!

												I remember waiting for this game a few years ago when it was first announced and my friend and I were looking forward to it coming out, then remembering it got delayed for a whole year and we had to wait for what felt like forever. After getting the game, it was fantastic. Looked beautiful (which is suprising for a game set in an apocalypse-like situation) but obviously graphic-wise it was and still is pretty stunning. Have played a fair amount of this game as you can see. The DLC called "The Following" was an excellent addition to the game however it really only added another 7 missions but at least it was in a whole new area with driveable vehicles. All the DLC together has added about another 100+ hours to my gameplay just by trying to do all the side missions, etc.Recommend this game to any zombie-thriller / survival fans out there. However once you play for about 25 hours it might start seeming a little boring and after the campaigns are done basically it felt to me like there was no worth anymore.Goodnight. And Good luck fellow survivors.

content:
Posted: February 10, 2015
												Dying Light is a zombie game which isn't shy of upholding cliches but does so in a fun and innovative way. Comparing the game to Dead Island (: Riptide) the game has fixed a lot of the core flaws and completely rebooted the story in a new setting with new parkour mechanics. The game does this very well, you start up with a character which is fumbling around in the dark, has no idea what to do and your parkouring still has to evolve. The pacing is really good for the first few hours. However this turns into disaster real quick. If you start co-op and do a few side-quests, your leveling will lead you to overpowered skills much too fast, obliberating minibosses with a few hits while that shouldn't feel possible as it makes the kills majorly disappointing. It goes from bad to normal to holy♥♥♥♥♥♥I'm a biotic spiderman with guns parkour, which is fun for new players to the freerunning scene but doesn't feel as fun for the purist parkour-only Mirror's Edge players.The story, as-is, is a bit lackluster. It doesn't include backstory (just a bit in the side-quests) and you don't really feel as if you're involved in a greater world with a lot of things going on. The architecture and levels reflect this, have a lot of conflicting design choices. Of course, this is Techland and they did not think this through, no biggie, the gameplay makes up for it. Smashing zombies in and running around the place with the day-night mechanics makes for a very fun game where you just want to run around and explore every inch.Even though the scaling isn't brilliant and the story isn't up to par, the gameplay, gunplay, graphics are all awesome and fun. If you can see through the 00's zombie action movie cliches, love blowing♥♥♥♥♥♥up with your fists and traps and you really like freedom of movement in a game, Dying Light is just for you.

												Best zombi game out there, and one of the best fps.From the creators of dead island, developed in their own engine (Chroma 6), this game absolutely capture the very best of a trully fps, combined with great touches of rpg and great parkour similar.PROS:- Great parkour system, plagued with and overwhelming skill tree.- Great storyline.- A lot of content about 60h+ without the expansion.- Recently remastered, runs great on medium hardware.- The feeling of danger of the night, one of the best aspects of the game, pushes you to take risk.- Coop / PvP seamesly integrated in the solo campaign.CONS:- Boring crafting system, with always same ingredients to recolect, sometimes becomes tedious, and very scarce recipes that add nothing normally, and not push to clear secondary missions.- Poor sense of reward in the loot present in the game world, except main missions.

content:
Posted: February 4, 2015
												After finishing the game, figured I'd give a short review.The game definately has some downfalls, but it can also be very fun at times. If you're looking for a game that has a good story, this is NOT one of them. Pros:- Amazing zombie killing mechanics. Slo-mo head explosions, decapatations, amputations, and thousands of creative ways to murder a zombie.- Creative, different zombie types.- Awesome night time gameplay, truly terrifying.- Great difficulty scaling. Fighting a zombie horde is actually something you may need to avoid, as a situation can turn from a fun zombie killing spree to being eaten alive.- Fantastically fun to play online as a zombie, and even better to play the Co-op campaign.- Weapon crafting is creative, and adds a lot of substance. The ability to modify stats is an added bonus.- Side quests and the open world aspects presented after you have completed the game means you get about a hundred hours of gameplay, depending on how much you like murdering the undead.- Lots to do!Cons:- The game itself isn't optimized very efficiently. Some areas drop your FPS considerably, and in general, using hardware that normally allowed you to play AAA titles on high will only net you a Medium-High. (Tip- Turn down View Distance, it has little impact on gameplay since its mostly Melee). I assume this will be fixed by patches.- Storyline is bland and predictable, the game's attempt at creating an emotional attachment to characters laughably falls through, and you soon find yourself forgetting the names that reappear or are mentioned mid to late game. Most campaign missions put you through mazes, or a generally recycled premises. (Like how many times do you have to be stripped of your weapons? Every single major encounter.)- The parkour mechanics need some work, prepare to fall to your death a few times when your character grabs onto a beam, only to scale and jump over it (Not a good idea on high heights) or even fail to grab a ledge altogether. The grappling hook is pretty.. Interesting too.- The minimap is terrible. Using the indicator to find quest locations. safehouses, etc results in frustration. - There's really no use for money. You can accumulate great amounts, but the weapons sold by the shop tend to be worse than your current- or only 30 minutes away from finding it on a dead guy.In summary :Don't buy the game for it's storyline. It sucks. Other than that, if you just want something to play with your friends then it is a great choice. Or if you just like the good old zombie killing action. Most other issues, like poor optimization and weird parkour mechanics, can be fixed through patches.For what its worth, I'd rate it6.5/10

content:
Posted: February 5, 2015
												To start off, the parkour is very well done.  Less restrictive and glitchy than Assassin's Creed.  -The gameplay is very similar to Dead Island, a little too similar.  You can see shared animations between the two games, which isn't necessarily a bad thing in this case.  -The shooter segments are pretty poorly done to be honest.  There aren't many guns, but they aren't very useful anyway.  Why are there different values and colors for guns that have identical stats and skins??? The animations are just as funky as Dead Island in terms of guns.  If there were suppressors, then maybe it would have a bit more depth.  -PLEASE OPTIMIZE YOUR GAME BEFORE RELEASE!!! I had to knock down the graphics to 720p and everything else on low just to get ~30-40 FPS.  This should not be happening on a GTX 760!! It's not the most powerful card, but it sure can handle a lot more than this game looks.  This is a PC!! 60 FPS is the minimum expectation on low settings with a reasonable rig! This isn't a ♥♥♥♥♥♥ console!! *SPOILER ALERT*- The story is meh at best.  I'm not sure if there was supposed to be a little romance between Crane and Jade.  Some cutscenes are illogical and out of place.  Cut his hand off, but let him live to extend the story?  Insert a far cry 3/4 hallucination level which honestly doesn't make much sense.  I don't think everyone infected traveled through a floating wonder world before they ate someone. It is also SUPER predictable. I was not surprised at any point. I'm not sure if I was supposed to be either.-The voice acting is ok, could use a little more authenticity in their vocals.  Sometimes they don't show much emotion, as if they're reading someone else's script (that's pretty much what they do anyway).  Bioshock infinite is an example of voice acting done right.- Some of the crafting doesn't make much sense.  I need a box of metal parts to bend a paper clip to use as a lockpick??  At least the lockpicking is familiar to Skyrim or Fallout 3 players and not the least bit glitchy.  The blueprints and upgrades are pretty standard, but at least it works like it should. It's a shame you can't make zombies fly with your great hammer of thor like you could in Dead Island.-I think there is enough to recommend, just barely.  I wouldn't get addicted to it like I did with Skyrim.  -The missions are good with variety.-I love the night segment since that actually made my♥♥♥♥♥pucker up.-Why is there no manual saving option?  I understand the "sleep here to save your game", but I've BSOD'd twice and each time it happened I had already completed a few quests, which were not saved.  Why is there no save at the end of a quest???  Sure it could boost authenticity and immersion, but taking out that option just forces us to back track multiple times to make sure our progress was actually saved.  This is a major disappointment for me.  I don't like having to back track for something that should be in the menu. Overall, the story sort of ruined it for me.  There isn't much immersion especially when compared to games like Metro Last Light.  For me, I consider a game a good buy if I at least get 1 hour per dollar of enjoyable game time.  I'm on the second playthrough and I'm already forcing myself to play, trying to find something interesting and unique. Just over 20 hours played.  I'm getting the same feeling I got with Wolfenstein: The New Order, "why did I pay $60 for this?"  I'm someone who prefers context.  Best example I can think of is: sex with a hooker < sex with a lover. Seriously, I felt unfufilled after I beat the game. It's fun otherwise.  5/10

content:
Posted: February 8, 2015
												Waited just about 2 years for this game and end result? I am LOVING this game ^_^Pros:-> Parkour around the map-> Get to higher lvls to use grappling hook for extra mobility in parkour ;) (spiderman style) -> Skill tree builds are awesome when maxed out anything is possible at night :) -> Graphics are awesome at high resolution-> Dropkick, vault (jump from 1 zombie head), stomp (break zombie head by stompping it ^_^ ), break zombie legs - arms - body - head or stun them in general, ram the zombies-> Ram or Dropkick a zombie off of a building or a bridge :) -> good weapon mods to build and customize to a lot of damage, I got a short sword for 2.2k dmg - 84 dura - 134 handle - 5 repair. It has Fire 2 Lightning 2 artibutes and its fun to have ^_^-> Weapon needed is a short sword, machete then you see 1 zombie jump and slash? Now you get 2 zombie pieces :) from head down you split the zombie into 2-> Certain protect quests will give you a chance to restore the lost repairs on a weapon, like the short sword I mentioned above for example to have 2 repairs left and then you do this protect quest and at the end instead of just cash or a weapon it will offer you to restore it back to full durability and 5 repairs which is awesome. Middle:-> The story I will do some were around the middle which is not too bad but too good either since you probably can guess how it will end. If only it had a suprize plot twist ;) like if the player did a certain side quest it would change the result of the ending. Cons: -> There is a cave off of where lavender plants are, and that cave has some invisible rocks. So if you go in there you might get stuck if you don't have any flares on you then you are really stuck. -> (my experience) The Spitters, when they hit you with their poison it drops the frames down from up high to down low. Sometimes it's okay but sometimes its not when there is a bomber around the corner :( -> If only on Game+ (meaning game was finished 100% and restarted on same thing but higher difficulty) the night runners aka voltiles did more damage when resistance poition was used. Like the resistance poition had less effect so that the night would still be good ;) -> Maybe on Game+ (advanced mode) it would have hidden abilites unlocked other wise going through the same quests might get a bit boring if there is nothing to spend those exp on. My stats where maxed out around 45% of main story completion before the Game+ advanced higher difficulty mode thing. I have got over 30 of these air drop things and I cant use them since my survivor stats are maxed out... I could give them to friends but other than that just dropping them off to quartermaster serves no purpose much. If it had more stats so that I can spend exp on I would have given it a 10, or the story line part too to get that 10. Other than those my overall rating would be 9/10.

content:
Posted: February 8, 2015
												Developed by Techland, yup that same company that made Dead Island games, is in my opinion one of the best zombie themed game I have ever played. The key differenced between dead island and dying light is very substantial. The element of parkour (Mirror's Edge style) through an open world, leaping over obstacles and standing up on ledges rooftops but in first person view (some what Assasin's Creed style) is an extraordinarily perfect fit for this game. Unlocking safe houses and cascading up radio towers to claim them (Far Cry 3/4 style), and collecting crafting items to craft melee weapons is very satisfying. There are a few variety of pistols and rifles that you can pick up and use, but the most staisfying part of the game is seeing the dismantling of body parts with the swing of a blunt, or sharp edged weapon. Also dropkicking zombies into oblivion is the best part of it all. The replayability is suprisingly very high, because there are multiple side quests you can play solo or coop you can take on, and you can play online with other people  as a human or a zombie player is  most definitely the juiciest part of the meat. 10/10

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 8, 2015
												The Dead Island sequel we've all been waiting for! Techland improved a lot of the mechanics. The parkour addition makes the world accessible vertically and feels great. Good game for completionists looking to get the most bang for their buck.PROS:-Dead Island with parkour-Excellent skill tree progression gives the game a nice RPG feel as you level up-Tons of content for completionists-Looks awesome in motion. Very nice looking overall.-Day/Night cycles. Night time really ups the tension with special infected and higher XP gains.-Sense of verticality is unparalleled. Was never affraid of heights in a game until Dying LightCONS:-Weapon crafting/variety was much better in Dead Island. Seems like Techland went backwards in this regard.-Only one protagonist, even in multiplayer! Dead Island handled multiplayer much better.-The final encounter is single player only! (This is not a spoiler, the game tells you before you approach it.)-No vehiclesNOTE: The game has nvidia-centric features. AMD users should do some research BEFORE buying.So in a nutshell, diehard DI fans should feel right at home. Just don't expect the same refined co-op experience. Also, the game rips off iconic ideas from mainstream games like Far Cry and Assassins Creed. Not a bad thing in my book, but some may consider this a con. Lastly, expect a very cliche and predictable story. Didn't add this as a con since DI games were never going to win an award for original story telling. It's all about the side quests!I enjoyed all 43 hours of my experience and can't wait to dive back in!

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 4, 2015
												After finishing the game, figured I'd give a short review.The game definately has some downfalls, but it can also be very fun at times. If you're looking for a game that has a good story, this is NOT one of them. Pros:- Amazing zombie killing mechanics. Slo-mo head explosions, decapatations, amputations, and thousands of creative ways to murder a zombie.- Creative, different zombie types.- Awesome night time gameplay, truly terrifying.- Great difficulty scaling. Fighting a zombie horde is actually something you may need to avoid, as a situation can turn from a fun zombie killing spree to being eaten alive.- Fantastically fun to play online as a zombie, and even better to play the Co-op campaign.- Weapon crafting is creative, and adds a lot of substance. The ability to modify stats is an added bonus.- Side quests and the open world aspects presented after you have completed the game means you get about a hundred hours of gameplay, depending on how much you like murdering the undead.- Lots to do!Cons:- The game itself isn't optimized very efficiently. Some areas drop your FPS considerably, and in general, using hardware that normally allowed you to play AAA titles on high will only net you a Medium-High. (Tip- Turn down View Distance, it has little impact on gameplay since its mostly Melee). I assume this will be fixed by patches.- Storyline is bland and predictable, the game's attempt at creating an emotional attachment to characters laughably falls through, and you soon find yourself forgetting the names that reappear or are mentioned mid to late game. Most campaign missions put you through mazes, or a generally recycled premises. (Like how many times do you have to be stripped of your weapons? Every single major encounter.)- The parkour mechanics need some work, prepare to fall to your death a few times when your character grabs onto a beam, only to scale and jump over it (Not a good idea on high heights) or even fail to grab a ledge altogether. The grappling hook is pretty.. Interesting too.- The minimap is terrible. Using the indicator to find quest locations. safehouses, etc results in frustration. - There's really no use for money. You can accumulate great amounts, but the weapons sold by the shop tend to be worse than your current- or only 30 minutes away from finding it on a dead guy.In summary :Don't buy the game for it's storyline. It sucks. Other than that, if you just want something to play with your friends then it is a great choice. Or if you just like the good old zombie killing action. Most other issues, like poor optimization and weird parkour mechanics, can be fixed through patches.For what its worth, I'd rate it6.5/10

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 5, 2015
												To start off, the parkour is very well done.  Less restrictive and glitchy than Assassin's Creed.  -The gameplay is very similar to Dead Island, a little too similar.  You can see shared animations between the two games, which isn't necessarily a bad thing in this case.  -The shooter segments are pretty poorly done to be honest.  There aren't many guns, but they aren't very useful anyway.  Why are there different values and colors for guns that have identical stats and skins??? The animations are just as funky as Dead Island in terms of guns.  If there were suppressors, then maybe it would have a bit more depth.  -PLEASE OPTIMIZE YOUR GAME BEFORE RELEASE!!! I had to knock down the graphics to 720p and everything else on low just to get ~30-40 FPS.  This should not be happening on a GTX 760!! It's not the most powerful card, but it sure can handle a lot more than this game looks.  This is a PC!! 60 FPS is the minimum expectation on low settings with a reasonable rig! This isn't a ♥♥♥♥♥♥ console!! *SPOILER ALERT*- The story is meh at best.  I'm not sure if there was supposed to be a little romance between Crane and Jade.  Some cutscenes are illogical and out of place.  Cut his hand off, but let him live to extend the story?  Insert a far cry 3/4 hallucination level which honestly doesn't make much sense.  I don't think everyone infected traveled through a floating wonder world before they ate someone. It is also SUPER predictable. I was not surprised at any point. I'm not sure if I was supposed to be either.-The voice acting is ok, could use a little more authenticity in their vocals.  Sometimes they don't show much emotion, as if they're reading someone else's script (that's pretty much what they do anyway).  Bioshock infinite is an example of voice acting done right.- Some of the crafting doesn't make much sense.  I need a box of metal parts to bend a paper clip to use as a lockpick??  At least the lockpicking is familiar to Skyrim or Fallout 3 players and not the least bit glitchy.  The blueprints and upgrades are pretty standard, but at least it works like it should. It's a shame you can't make zombies fly with your great hammer of thor like you could in Dead Island.-I think there is enough to recommend, just barely.  I wouldn't get addicted to it like I did with Skyrim.  -The missions are good with variety.-I love the night segment since that actually made my♥♥♥♥♥pucker up.-Why is there no manual saving option?  I understand the "sleep here to save your game", but I've BSOD'd twice and each time it happened I had already completed a few quests, which were not saved.  Why is there no save at the end of a quest???  Sure it could boost authenticity and immersion, but taking out that option just forces us to back track multiple times to make sure our progress was actually saved.  This is a major disappointment for me.  I don't like having to back track for something that should be in the menu. Overall, the story sort of ruined it for me.  There isn't much immersion especially when compared to games like Metro Last Light.  For me, I consider a game a good buy if I at least get 1 hour per dollar of enjoyable game time.  I'm on the second playthrough and I'm already forcing myself to play, trying to find something interesting and unique. Just over 20 hours played.  I'm getting the same feeling I got with Wolfenstein: The New Order, "why did I pay $60 for this?"  I'm someone who prefers context.  Best example I can think of is: sex with a hooker < sex with a lover. Seriously, I felt unfufilled after I beat the game. It's fun otherwise.  5/10

content:
Posted: May 20, 2015
												To start this off with a twist when the game was first publicly under development and all the way up to launch I didn't think much of it, wasn't hyped, and even went so far as to think it to be "just another zombie game". Boy oh boy was I wrong. A friend convinced me to get this recently 3 months or so after launch by now and I did. As soon as I got into the game and started I was entranced by the parkour, the beautiful graphics, the smooth and well optimized 60 FPS, the great and powerful feeling impact of the combat, and the intense and very real danger of being too loud or trying to fight more than one zombie. Some may disagree with this next part so don't get offended. It's just my opinion. I personally love the story, and the voice acting, and the way my character reacts throughout. The game is so good it even managed to manifest a strong sense of hatred within me towards the main antagonist "Rais". (Which is rare in games these days.) Pros:- Incredible smooth and impactful combat system.- Great fluid parkour system.- Wonderful story and very well made antagonist. (King of Cliches)- Tons of Easter Eggs and things to do that are non-linear.- Amazing and stunning graphics. (Very well optimized graphics at that too.)- Giant well designed open world.- Good zombie variety. (Normal, Biters, Exploders, Chasers, Climbers, Night Hunters... Plenty to keep you on your toes.)- Really good crafting system.- Lots of realism in the survival aspects.- Wonderful plethora of finishing moves / ways to gruesomely dispatch zombies.- Hilariously good dropkick feature.- Great range of weapons and weapon upgrades.- New major DLC only 3 months after launch.- Very respectable and not deaf developers.- Very stable servers.- Fluid Co-op gameplay.- Fun "BE THE ZOMBIE" mode available to everyone for free.- Really nice modding potential and modding is officially recognized by the developers.- Amazing replay value.CONS:- The rare odd zombie through a wall glitch- Meets a few stereotypes of other games (This is only a con to the majority, some like that in a game.)- Meany developers patched my favorite exploit. (Killing tower guard with propane tank smacks for a free gun.)OVERALL RATING: 9.5/10JUST ****ING BUY IT ALREADY.

number of helpful: 4 of 6 people (67%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: February 2, 2015
												Well, Where to begin with Dying Light.After finishing the main storyline with plenty of side quests that I missed, I can safely say that this game was quite something.-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------I'm not quite sure where to start with this review so I'll just start with the good stuff first.It holds good variety in weapons and zombies, As well as various human enemies, Both military and non-military. The parkour is, in my opinion, pretty smooth, Maybe not to Mirror's Edge standard but it gets the job done nicely. Combat feels very satisfying and well done, Especially with the dismemberment of body parts. Graphics aren't too bad, Even at a low resolution, The game still looked very pretty on my computer, though others may disagree. The variation between day and night offers a nice change in the gameplay, One minute you're a zombie killing badass, The next you're a wimpy baby hiding from corners and climbing rooftops as if your life depends on it, Because 9 times out of 10, it does.A few very small but noticable features in the game add to it's charm, Such as the three seperate skill trees, Survivor, Agility and Power, Each having unique perks that help improve the way you play the game (If you're not too busy dropkicking Zomboids off the rooftops to notice them). The menu's are similar to Dead Island, So those who played that should instantly be used to it, Though it's easy for new people to understand. Certain NPC's in the game can offer some valuable loot and a weapon completely for free,  Crafting feels very well done with the different varieties of blueprints you can find throughout the world or earn through quests (Flaming, Electrifying Sledgehammers FTW!) And it's open world gameplay with two different areas to explore: The Slums, where you start the game off and play about 70% of the game, The other being The City, Where you travel to during the main storyline and has much, much bigger buildings.I personally haven't played Multiplayer with any of my friends who also own the game but from the few random dudes who have joined my game whilst I play, I would say that the Multiplayer runs quite smoothly. As the host, It gives you plenty of oppertunities to set up challenges for you and your friends to complete, Such as kill the most zombies or find the most loot and whatever else the game decides. I do have a personal recommendation if you intend to go public online when you're playing so random people and friends can join you, TURN OFF ZOMBIE INVASION. If you don't want to be CONSTANTLY invaded by super zombies trying to munch your face off, Turn this off. If not, You'll most likely find yourself being invaded every 5 minutes with NO ONE to help you, You'll be left alone and have quite a disadvantage, Though if that's your kind of thing, Go right ahead.-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Plenty of good stuff to say about this game, Now for the bad stuff...The story isn't great. Pretty much throughout the entire thing, You can already see what will happen from miles away and most times they do. The characters aren't too interesting and some are completely forgettable, Even though this game tries at times to make you feel something for the characters and make you feel connected to them (I'm looking at you, Rahim.)The game takes a little while to bring out the different enemy variations, Which mainly consists of you having to play through the main storyline before you even see mutated zombies in the world and even then, You rarely notice any or don't pay enough attention to notice them, the most I've seen is the normal snappy bitey zombies, Some Viral zombies which come when you make noise (The super fast ones in daylight) and the big hulking fellas with metal rebars usually standing around in one place.And I cannot finish off this review without mentioning The Final Boss of the game, The psychopathic dude who has♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥you off, Killed your comrades and ultimately made your life terrible in this zombie apocalypse. It comes down to that final moment, you finally reach the top of his mighty tower after scratching and clawing your way past zomboids and virals and falling to the dirt many, many times. A cutscene comes along, You and your enemy face off and what do you know? QUICK TIME EVEEEEENT!!!! You could see it coming a mile away, A God Damn Quick Time Event for the final boss. Please bear in mind that other bosses in the game that you fight, The Main Boss's Right Hand Man being just one of them, You fight all of those in the game normally, Dodging and leaping and slashing and dying a lot. But oh no, Not with this final boss, They treat you with a nice little QTE right at the end and you could EASILY see it coming a mile off. A dissapointing ending, In my opinion.-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Well, If you could be bothered to read through all my rubbish, Welcome to the end! ~Confetti and Fanfare~So, Final opinion on Dying Light.Although it has a few faults in the game that can be noticed with ease and may annoy a lot of players, Especially that damn final boss, Does it make Dying Light a bad game? Not. At. All.It's Fun, It's Satisfying and it certainly lived up to my personal expectations when I first heard about it and got excited to play it.If you're a Zomboid fan, A Parkour Fan or you just like to slice dudes up and dropkick them from rooftops like a total boss, I HIGHLY recommend Dying Light to you. Some may argue about the asking price of this game but from what I've played and seen, I personally think it's worth it.Dying Light has been, In my opinion, A great start to a new year of gaming, I only hope that developers can keep this up for the months to come.Until Then, Catch ya later, Folks!Good Night And Good Luck!

content:
Posted: January 29, 2015
												Dying light is an astounding free roam parkour action packed zombie shooter game. It is by FAR the best zombie game I have played with few exceptions. I knew this game was going to be good when I found out it was made by the same creators as Dead Island (another great game). Dying light has a good storyline and crazy amounts of different missions you can do, ranging from gathering supplies to holding off a safehouse from zombies. There are an endless amount of different upgrades and customization features you can add to your weapons.  It is quite a long BUT fun game. Even after you complete the game you can still have COUNTLESS hours of fun. For 60$ this game is WELL WORTH THE MONEY. Even though it is still in early access, it is definitely playable. This is definitely a great adition to anyones steam library, I would recommend this game to anyone who likes action/adventure games.                                                   10/10

content:
Posted: February 3, 2015
												If you are familiar with the first Dead Island game or enjoyed slow paced zombie survival games, this is the game worth looking and getting. Gameplay wise, it's very similar to Dead Island but thrown in some Mirror's Edge parkour and Far Cry Series. There are lot's to explore in the fictional City of Harran and plenty of collectables. There are lot's of weapons to find, upgrade, and customize for entertainment. The zombies are very satisfying to kill with the nice detail gore to it. There are plenty of side quest to do and they are not really repetitive but rather fun and sometimes very rewarding to do. You'll spend a good 20~ hours into this game with all the side quest and exploring.

number of helpful: 4 of 6 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 4, 2015
												This review is based on my personal opinion.This review will NOT contain spoilers.Every once in a while, I start up my PC feeling wonderful and I wanna play something.This game is always there for me when I feel like I have nothing to play because it's fun to slice zombies up in many different areas multiple times and you'd be proud of yourself because it just feels so rewarding.People who fear scary games should play this though. It remedies your fear. A lot. Because if you want this game but you fear of going outside from safe zones cause there are biters everywhere? Well.. you can't complete anything without fighting them. (Except farm your agility up so high for hours and hours because it takes a long time to do so but agility takes you nowhere because you'd have no fighting skills right?.. right..)But to summarize the gameplay. It has many varities in weapons and I'm not going to mention them here because it's fun to discover them and many of them have their own pros and cons. Regular zombies are like dust on the streets and other types of zombies.. well.. if you're interested... find it out for yourself. They're not hard. Kinda.. *Wink* *Wink*Co-op is excellent and it has even a LAN mode which is quite rare for a game of this time.Newcomers, here's a warning to you: You do NOT want to rush into Be The Zombie mode. It will make you rage quit multiple times. It's a gamemode for tryhards at most but you do NOT need to play this mode to get the full experience of this game. This game DOES have seamless co-op. (Yes you can stay in front of a zombie with your friend and kick the zombie about a 1000 times without having to worry about disconnecting due to inactivity on quests and side quests)On the performance side of things:You will not play this game on max settings. It is impossible. Even with Nvidia settings off it is quite hard to get stable FPS with view distance slider to the fullest extent of its reach because game casts shadows on everything on its screen. (Even the building that haven't been rendered completely? Yes even those and not low quality either. They'll be full HD shadows if you crank your distance to the max)Core i3-3220 would be my personal suggestion of a minimum 1080p smooth experience as I'm running this on 25% View  Distance. Textures, Foliage and Shadows are on the highest quality possible which is High. No Ultra here folks, you'll achieve Ultra with Nvidia Gameworks settings if you enable them. Which you shouldn't cause they cause such a hassle that you'll barely stop stuttering for a few seconds. Yes. Even with an i5. Just not as much as my i3.Basically anyone who has a better rig than mine will run standard 1080p High settings. If you have a monster rig you can go for some of the gameworks settings. I don't recommend it though because 30 FPS isn't acceptable here. 40-60 minimum for a good clean experience in fighting and intense situations.Summarized version: This game has a few bugs. Runs nicely on old systems if you know the capabilities and tinker with the settings right. Story is quite interesting. Has seamless co-op. Nice number of side quests. Spend your time out in the night at your own risk, it's really hard for newcomers and good night, good luck.

												Overall this game is very fun, but there are several problems that may question you wanting to buy this game. Here are the Pros & Cons.-Pros:Fun, fluent gameplay with an outstanding parkour systemThere is so much to do throughout the mapI have never wanted to 100% a game so muchThe combat is also fluent and doesn't get very repetitiveThe co-op is very funny and some things you can do are complete jokes-Cons:Trash story that is very shortWhoever wrote this had a book of cliche's right next to him (Bad guy screams your name, leaves you for dead, says your   not a man, and there is a quick-time event at the end)Fetch quests are the new meta?FPS drops here and there-Be The Zombie is broken:   Survivor sense is overpowered and defeats the purpose of hunting survivors when they hunt the Night Hunter   The Night Hunter has to defend even thought he supposedly "hunts"   Connection is so trash, especially in BTZ   Early levels of BTZ are very frustratingCo-op is pretty sloppy when it comes to animations, connection, and style.Poor DLC (So Far)Overall, it is a fun, singleplayer game that has solid gameplay, but everything else is pretty bad. If you make this purchase, keep in mind that it is for the zombie-whacking hardcore-parkour experience, not the story.

content:
Posted: March 6, 2015
												I was afraid of getting this because it seemed like "Yet Another Zombie [Thing]". Across my entire library, I only had one other zombie game. It's simply not a genre I care about because I generally find zombies to be fairly boring enemies to fight. But after poking the reviews and seeing a lot of comments like "20 hours played, 15% of story complete. 10/10", this implied that there was more to the game that it seemed. Indeed, I took a chance and dropped the full 60$ on this and I turned out to be fairly surprised, and pleasantly so.For me, what sets this apart is the ability to parkour around. This makes traversing the cityscape a lot more interesting and keeps this game from being a boring slog "Point A to Point B" with some zombie-smacking in between.What I continue to love most about this game is how it's multi-genre'd. After a few hours of play, by day, you'll be a powerhouse with weapons that will be able to one-shot the standard zombies (If you aim properly). Daytime is scavenging/questing time.But by night, it becomes a prolonged stealth mission. Double experience gain, a few quests that can ONLY be done at night, and enemies that will destroy you regardless of levels and weapon statistics, if you allow yourself to be 'alerted' for too long. Every night is absolutely intense and it's just great fun.Add to the fact that once you encounter "Bolters", enemies that will literally flee at the sight of you, hunting them is like an assassination mission as you can only kill them by sneaking up behind them. You could shoot them, too, but have fun with its four Volatile buddies that like to hang out.So what's keeping me on this game is the variance it offers. Traversing the land is fun, slaughting zombies en masse is great, and sneaking around at night is an intense and great experience.I've been recommending this to most of my friends.

												I WAS APPREHENSIVE. I didn't wanna buy another zombie game since I already had DayZ, Infestation, H1Z1, etc.I kept putting it off because I was bored with it all but I saw it on sale for 30 bucks on {LINK REMOVED}cdkeys.com.What the hell.I now can't stop. Especially after the massive scene on the suspension bridge trying to find a specific quest item.The strumming, thumping music as I closely observed how realistic the infected behaviour was. They really have created a movie like experience that you actually get scared and tense to. The slow zombies aren't too bad unless they gather up on you but once you create a ruckuss the sprinters come and they are very rabid. The animations are so lifelike I sometimes felt sad when their humanity comes out and they plead for forgiveness but they still scream and lose control. All the zombies are tough as nails especially the larger zombies, vomiters and such.At night, that is the real scary moment. The extremely aggressive mutant infected are panther-like and tough to get by but with your parkour skills and crafting you will overcome.The graphics with ambient animations, weather and ai acting is so cinematic and immersive. I would like to play this with an Occulus Rift.I highly recommend this game. Believe me you will not be dissapointed and your wallet won't scream if you can get a deal. Why wouldn't anyone not want a good gamer deal? I have spent more for games that I hardly ever play but I swear to finish this one.

content:
Posted: April 7, 2015
												Like expected, it is similar to Dead Island in a lot of ways. So, where does it differ? Well, the graphics and general tone of the game are a lot grittier and darker than Dead Island. Think of this as the Empire Strikes Back to Dead Island's Star Wars. The looting and melee part of the game is very similar. You pick up, trade, craft weapons and use blueprints to upgrade them and so on. They increase in damage as you level up and unlock rarer varieties. The free-running is unique here - I don't think I have ever seen it done in a first person game before. It is both a blessing and a curse. It's a blessing because when it works, it works really well and gives a new depth to the game that would not have existed without it. It's a curse because it can be extremely fiddly and disorientating. Sometimes things just don't seem to work as well as they should and simple things turn into frustration inducing annoyances. It's a real shame too, since the system is *almost* good. Example: want to climb down and hang on the ledge? Forget it, something this simple is possibly the most frustrating thing you will ever do in this game. This game also features a unique night-time experience where you must run, dodge and hide from powerful super-zombies during night time. Unlike the normal Z's, these ones chase you and can run just as fast as you can. When they catch you it's game over - so a race for the nearest safe-zone ensues. This part of the game really fills you with panicked adrenaline and mixes up the pace of the game. It is a welcome and interesting addition. The (side) quests suffer from the same thing they did in Dead Island - fetchy and boring for the most part. There is one exception that I have found so far. In order to tell you about this I will just explain what happened to me: I was tasked by a man in the "tower" to power up 2 electricity generators in town and then head to the main distribution center and power that up. There was a catch - the center is crawling with Z's - I mean, hundreds of the ♥♥♥♥ers - and that's not all, I have to do it AT NIGHT time so that all the Z's get fried when I power it up. First I went and powered up the other 2 sub-stations with little issue. When I reached the main one I think my exact words were something along the lines of "holy ♥♥♥♥ing ♥♥♥♥ ♥♥♥♥". There WERE hundreds of them. I gingerly scouted the area (in the day-time still), to see what I was going to do. There was a small entrance in the fence at the front and no other way in. I also didn't know which of the buildings I had to reach to turn on the generators. I dashed through the fence and jumped onto a van. A horde surrounded me within seconds and I was trapped. Fumbling through my inventory I fashioned 2 molotovs and let rip. The Z's burned and I jumped down. A second massive horde approached and I jumped back onto the van. I spent a few minutes trying to thin the heard, but after a time realised this was not going to work. Low on health, weapons all broken I decided I had to make a break for it. I jumped over several Z heads and ran for an opening, hoping it would lead me somewhere. Z's where everywhere and I was dodging and jumping past them. I came to a fence and vaulted over it. The area was "safe" and had a building. I went in and found the generator I was meant to use - some good luck that this was the right building. Problem was, it was day-time. Fair enough, at least I knew where to come now. I marked the location that I was standing on my map and made my escape. I headed to the nearest safe-zone where I slept until night time... Night was here. It was pitch black. I couldn't see more than 2 metres in front of me without a torch - yet the torch attracted zombies. Great. It's okay, I knew the terrain now and I had a custom waypoint set. All I had to do was get there without anything seeing me. I made my way to the station, slowly, avoiding all the "super-z's". When I got to the station my heart sank - one of the super-z's was pacing along the bit of fence that I had to get through. Bugger. Checking my inventory I found a couple of firecrackers. Hmmmm. I chucked some in the opposite direction and it vaulted over to them, attracting some of the massive horde inside as well. This was it. This was my moment. I ran. Jumping over the van, onto some z-heads. I got stuck on my planned route because there were too many of them. I had to think fast as they were everywhere. At this point I had little choice, I had to turn my torch on to see what was going on. I did. All the Z's turned and began after me. I climbed up a nearby generator before taking a running jump into the enclosure. Running to the building I slammed the door behind me and turned on the generator. I made it, phew. The sound of electric fizzing outside caught my attention and I went for a look. Sure enough, most of the horde was now being fried. One more firecracker left, I chucked it and made my escape. On the way out a super-z noticed me and gave chase. I was clambering up buildings, over fences, through houses to make it to the safe-zone. I picked up about 4 of these super-Z's on the way but finally managed to get the the safe zone. I lit up a cigarette and congratulated myself on a job well done. "You see, preparation is key, bur?", I said to myself.That's a side quest. It has turned out to be my most memorable moment in the game as of yet. When it works, it works really well. This story above however, is not the only way the game works sadly. A lot of time is spent running from point to point doing meaningless fetch quests and trying to climb buildings (and failing) over and over again. It does suffer because of this and the tedious running from point to point doing nothing but boring quests drops my score down from a 8 to a 7. Sure, I can skip this content, but I would miss out on a good chunk of the game as a result.It's a real shame that you begin to become OP later in the game, as the "survival" aspect of the game's early hours where you are scrounging for supplies and having to come up with genius plans to tackle the horde are it's strongest, definitive moments. As the game progresses, this gets thrown out of the window and you are left with another zombie smasher game with free-running tagged on.Jimbo Rating: 7/10
